title: Clinton Library: WHORM files related to Zurab Tsereteli and "The Birth of a New World" Columbus statue

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

White House Office of Records Management (WHORM) files related to the sculptor Zurab Tsereteli (Georgian: ზურაბ წერეთელი) and a sculpture of his of Christopher Columbus titled "The Birth of a New World."

For background: in 1997 the Moscow mayor's office offered a statue of Tsereteli's as a gift to the city of New York. Donald Trump lobbied to have the city allow him to place it at one of his developments. Mayor Giuliani lobbied against the statue, and for the next 18 years it was offered to other cities. 

Please search WHORM files for records related to Zurab Tsereteli and the late 1990s offer from the Russians for the statue. Keywords: Zurab Tsereteli, ზურაბ წერეთელი

For additional information: https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2016/06/trump-files-donald-almost-built-gigantic-christopher-columbus-statue/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Border Patrol Agent Suicides
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents related to Border Patrol agent suicides from 2019 to 2025. The documents include but are not limited to a spreadsheet or list of Border Patrol agent deaths that have been reported as a suicide.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicole Spirea
